sage.renderer.jogl

Class JOGLRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.renderer.AbstractRenderer
      • sage.renderer.jogl.JOGLRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener, IRenderer

    public class JOGLRenderer
extends AbstractRenderer
implements IRenderer, javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener
    This class implements the IRenderer interface using the JOGL Java interface to OpenGL (http://jogamp.org), providing a JOGL-based renderer. The renderer maintains separate queues for opaque, transparent, and orthographic SceneNodes, processing (drawing) those queues in this order when processRenderQueue() is invoked.

    The default RENDER_METHOD is IMMEDIATE; the renderer also supports the VERTEX_ARRAY method (but, as of this writing, not the VBO method).

    The implementation provides support for automatic buffer swapping at the completion of each IRenderer.processRenderQueue() invocation if the implementation's autoSwapEnabled flag is true. The default value for autoSwapEnabled is false.

    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Nested Class Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JOGLRenderer()
      Constructs a JOGLRenderer with a default RENDER_MODE of IMMEDIATE and using a JOGL GLCanvas, with autoswapping disabled, for drawing.

    • Method Detail

      • addToRenderQueue

        public void addToRenderQueue(SceneNode n)
        Adds the specified SceneNode to the appropriate render queue (based on the SceneNode.RENDER_MODE of the SceneNode), after first checking to see whether the SceneNode can be culled (omitted from further processing) based on the SceneNode.CULL_MODE of the node.

        Culling is based on whether the world bounding volume of the SceneNode intersects the camera view frustum. If the node can't be culled (that is, its world bounding volume does intersect the camera view frustum), then if the SceneNode is a Leaf it is added to the appropriate render queue based on its SceneNode.RENDER_MODE; if it is a Group then its children are passed to this method recursively.

        Specified by:
        addToRenderQueue in interface IRenderer
        Parameters:
        n - - the SceneNode to be added to the rendering queue

      • processRenderQueue

        public void processRenderQueue()
        Instructs the JOGLRenderer to render (draw) the contents of its Opaque, Transparent, and Orthographic queues, in that order.
        Specified by:
        processRenderQueue in interface IRenderer

      • enableOrthoMode

        public void enableOrthoMode(boolean enable)
        Enables or disables orthographic mode in the renderer. When orthographic mode is enabled the renderer uses an orthographic (rather than a perspective) projection regardless of which render queue an object is placed in.
        Specified by:
        enableOrthoMode in interface IRenderer
        Parameters:
        enable - - true to put the renderer in orthographic projection mode; false to restore the previous projection mode

      • isInOrthoMode

        public boolean isInOrthoMode()
        Returns an indication of whether the renderer is currently in "orthographic" rendering mode.
        Specified by:
        isInOrthoMode in interface IRenderer
        Returns:
        true if the renderer is in orthographic mode, else false

      • init

        public void init(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        init() is a callback method associated with the JOGL OpenGL rendering context; it is invoked by the underlying implementation to initialize the OpenGL system. This method should never be called directly by application (game) code.
        Specified by:
        init in interface javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener

      • reshape

        public void reshape(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable gLDrawable,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        reshape() is a callback method associated with the underlying JOGL OpenGL system; it is invoked by OpenGL whenever the drawable object (e.g the renderer's Canvas) has been resized. Currently the method does nothing (which has the side effect that any attempt to resize the application window, or the Canvas in the window, can produce unpredictable results.

        Application (game) code should never call this method directly.

        Specified by:
        reshape in interface javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setRenderMethod

        public void setRenderMethod(IRenderer.RENDER_METHOD renderMethod)
        Sets the renderer's RENDER_METHOD to the specified value. Note that RENDER_METHOD refers to the technique used within the renderer for drawing objects (Immediate mode vs. Vertex Arrays, for example), and not to any properties of the SceneNodes being rendered.
        Specified by:
        setRenderMethod in interface IRenderer
        Parameters:
        renderMethod - - the preferred rendering method the renderer should use if the hardware supports it

      • swapBuffers

        public void swapBuffers()
        Instructs the renderer to swap its front and back buffers, causing the content of the back buffer to be displayed. This method should not be invoked if the application has enabled auto-swapping via a call to IRenderer.setAutoSwapEnabled(boolean) with true.
        Specified by:
        swapBuffers in interface IRenderer

      • setAutoSwapEnabled

        public void setAutoSwapEnabled(boolean onOff)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderer
        Instructs the IRenderer implementation to enable or disable automatic back-buffer swapping at the completion of an IRenderer.processRenderQueue() invocation. IRenderer implementations may (but are not required to) implement automatic buffer swapping at the completion of IRenderer.processRenderQueue() when their autoswap enabled flag is true.
        Specified by:
        setAutoSwapEnabled in interface IRenderer
        Parameters:
        onOff - - the new value of the IRenderer's autoswap enabled flag

      • setVerbose

        public void setVerbose(boolean onOff)
        Enables/disables an internal flag which causes the renderer to display verbose information about what it is doing; initially OFF (false). Warning: enabling verbose mode generates a lot of output!
        Parameters:
        onOff - - true to enable verbose display; false to disable
